page.title: 07HOME LIFE - Lydham/More
page.content: {Family life}is important and forms a closely knit community. Farming families work together and children seldom suffer from boredom. Many people keep pets: dogs, cats, rabbits, ponies, guinea pigs, ferrets, birds, and one man breeds Shire Horses. As all the houses have{sizeable gardens, flower, fruit and vegetable growing is a favourite pastime.Crafts, sports and dancing are some of the many hobbies. Home produce is frozen or preserved and many families enjoy weekends picnicking, walking and picking local wimberries, blackberries, nuts and mushrooms.{'Home' cooking and baking {is still preferable to 'convenience {foods',}though 'cooked' breakfasts are not eaten as often now. Cars,(driven at 17), are a necessity. The majority of families work hard, play hard and live life happily to the full.
